contentrichtext.text: {{unreferenced|date=August 2012}} {{Odd polygon db|Odd polygon stat table|p19}} In [[geometry]], an '''enneadecagon''' is a [[polygon]] with 19 sides and angles. It is also known as an '''enneakaidecagon''' or a '''nonadecagon'''. The radius of the circumcircle of the [[regular polygon|regular]] enneadecagon with side length ''t'' is :<math>R=\frac{t}{2} \csc \frac {180}{19}</math> (angle in degrees) The area of a regular enneadecagon, where ''t'' is the edge length, is :<math>\frac{19}{4}t^2 \cot \frac{\pi}{19}</math><br><math>\simeq 28.4652\,t^2.</math> ==Construction== A regular enneadecagon ''cannot'' be [[constructible polygon|constructed]] using a [[compass and straightedge]]. ===Petrie polygons=== The regular enneadecagon is the [[Petrie polygon]] for one higher dimensional polytope, projected in a skew [[orthogonal projection]]: {| class=wikitable |- align=center |[[File:18-simplex_t0.svg|150px]]<br>[[18-simplex]] (18D) |} ==External links== *{{MathWorld|title=Enneadecagon|urlname=Enneadecagon}} [[Category:Polygons]] {{Polygons}} {{Elementary-geometry-stub}}
